title.value: Successive-Cancellation Decoding of Reed-Muller Codes with Fast Hadamard Transform
title.justification: The title accurately reflects the novel encoding approach being proposed and tested in the research work.
title.quote: Successive-Cancellation Decoding of Reed-Muller Codes with Fast Hadamard Transform

extractions.description: This paper presents a new permuted fast successive-cancellation list decoding algorithm for Reed-Muller codes, utilizing the fast Hadamard transform (FHT). This innovative decoder attempts to improve error-correction capabilities while reducing computational complexity, decoding latency, and memory based on a new permutation strategy.

type.justification: The paper conducts simulations, presents numerical performance analysis for various configurations, and benchmarks against existing methods, indicating empirical study characteristics.
type.quote: The simulation results show that for a RM code of length 512 with 46 information bits...

name.justification: The research mainly revolves around improving decoding techniques for error-correction codes.
name.quote: Reed-Muller (RM) codes are a class of linear error-correction codes introduced by Muller [1] and Reed [2].

name.justification: The work discusses techniques related to signal processing such as the fast Hadamard transform.
name.quote: Therefore, the fast Hadamard transform (FHT) algorithm is used to optimally decode the first-order RM codes [13].

name.value: p-FHT-FSCL (permuted Fast Hadamard Transform Fast Successive-Cancellation List) decoder
name.justification: This model is explicitly marked as the core contribution of the paper and extensively studied for its performance.
name.quote: We propose a novel permuted FHT-FSCL (p-FHT-FSCL) decoding algorithm of RM codes to significantly improve the error-correction performance of the FHT-FSCL decoder [18].

is_contributed.justification: The model is introduced and explored as a novel contribution for improving decoding strategies.
is_contributed.quote: Our contributions are summarized as follows. 1) We propose a novel permuted FHT-FSCL (p-FHT-FSCL) decoding algorithm...

is_executed.justification: The paper presents simulation results and complexity analysis for the proposed decoding algorithm, implying execution of the model.
is_executed.quote: The simulation results show that for a RM code of length 512 with 46 information bits...

is_compared.justification: The paper numerically compares its proposed model against other state-of-the-art decoding techniques.
is_compared.quote: We numerically demonstrate that for various RM code configurations, the proposed decoders can obtain similar or better error-correction performance compared to that of the state-of-the-art permuted successive-cancellation decoder [27], the FHT-FSCL decoder [18], and RPA-based decoders [12], [19]...
